intro: Cristaria sadae, commonly known as the Sadae's cristaria, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep purple. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of silvery hairs. It thrives in cool, humid environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cristaria sadae is considered an endangered species.
